thread.title: The Jeep Wrangler Rattletrap is a Monster of a Machine
thread.title_full: The Jeep Wrangler Rattletrap is a Monster of a Machine

author: Jesse Bernard
title: The Jeep Wrangler Rattletrap is a Monster of a Machine
text:
Visit the original post to see all 6 images from this gallery. 
If you’ve been on the look out for the ultimate monster truck then you needn’t look further with the Jeep Wrangler Rattletrap’s gigantic presence. The monster truck named “Rattletrap” was built by the team at Martin Barkey Racing back in 2007 and is now available for purchase.
The ultra-capable off-roader boasts an impressive 500+ Horsepower Twin Turbo 5.9-Liter 12-Valve Cummins engine with 1000+ ft-lbs of Torque, in a JK body rolling on 44×19.5 Pit Bull Rocker tires, making it capable of tackling anything from dense forests, sand dunes, swamps, even climbing obstacles over 6 feet high.
To no surprise, the Jeep Wrangle Rattletrap doesn’t come cheap and retails at $225,000 but after looking at it, it’s definitely worth every single cent.
In other lifestyle related news, Porsche’s brand new Panamera Turbo S E-Hybrid is capable of reaching 0-60 mph in 3.2 seconds.
